Today, within the framework of the Union State, programs in the field of industry, energy, information technology, etc. are being implemented. Every year, the volume of trade turnover between Russia and Belarus is increasing at a record pace due to the high level of complementarity of the economies of our countries.💬V.V. And along this path we managed to achieve really a lot. Thanks to the successful implementation of 28 sectoral union programs, Russian and Belarusian legislation was unified, and the legal and organizational foundations of a common economic space were formed. Conditions have been created for the implementation of a unified macroeconomic and monetary policy, for joint work to minimize the damage from illegal Western restrictions.☝️The Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus confirms the cohesion of the two fraternal peoples, the desire to further strengthen interaction, which is based on the centuries-old traditions of friendship, close cultural and spiritual communications.📃On the occasion of the Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus, the President of the Russian Federation V.V. Lukashenko.🎊Congratulations on the holiday, symbolizing the inextricable bonds of fraternal friendship between our countries and peoples!

event: Approval of Russian Orbital Station Design
description: Roscosmos approved the preliminary design of the Russian Orbital Station (ROS), a base for Russian manned cosmonautics after the ISS. The station features an open modular architecture, allowing for easy replacement of failed modules. It will orbit the Earth in a polar orbit, providing an overview of the entire earth's surface, including the Northern Sea Route.
original:
Roscosmos approved the preliminary design of the Russian Orbital StationRoscosmos approved the preliminary design of the Russian Orbital Station (ROS). The station is intended to become a base for Russian manned cosmonautics after the completion of the ISS.

One of the key features of the future station is an open modular architecture, the state corporation reports. The basis of the design is a node module with six docking ports, to which other modules are connected. If one of them fails, it can be removed from orbit and replaced. Roscosmos is confident that with proper logistics, the service life of the station can be extended for decades as needed.
The state corporation added that the ROS will fly around the Earth in a polar orbit with an inclination of up to 97°, which will provide an overview of the entire earth's surface, including the Northern Sea Route. Now cosmonauts on board the ISS can see about 60% of the earth's surface, of which only about 10% is the territory of Russia. The station will also receive guaranteed stable communication with the ground control complex.
One of the main advantages of the Russian orbital station is high energy, which will allow testing and testing the technologies of popular equipment, for example, radars and high-power antenna systems. This work will be ensured, among other things, using power gyroscopic systems, which will allow maintaining the position of the station in space without engines and saving fuel. Roscosmos also emphasizes that the new station will be able to operate in visiting mode, that is, without the constant presence of cosmonauts.
The deployment of ROS in orbit is planned for the period from 2027 to 2032. First, the scientific-energy, hub and gateway modules will go into space, then the base module will be launched, which will take over the control functions of the station. Then the development of the station will be continued by target modules - habrGreat news, we hope that the project will be implemented! Let's keep our fingers crossed for our astronautics

description: The Francis Scott Key bridge over the Patapsco River in Baltimore, Maryland, collapsed after a container ship, MV Dali, collided with a support beam. Authorities are planning to create a temporary canal to allow ships with critical cargo to pass through.
original:
Forwarded from: Roscosmos State Corporation
In Baltimore, Maryland, the Francis Scott Key bridge over the Patapsco River collapsed.

The container ship MV Dali, 300 meters long and displacing about 100 thousand tons, collided with a support beam and was flying the Singapore flag from Baltimore to Colombo, the largest city in Sri Lanka.

The port is now closed and navigation is impossible until the wreckage is removed and the bottom is cleared. Naval ships are also stuck at the piers. The port and city authorities are planning to create a temporary canal in the northeastern part of the main canal, in the area of the bridge. This will allow ships with the most important cargo to pass through the canal. Image from the Kanopus-V satellite

“There is no serious destruction, the technological process of the enterprises has not been disrupted. In Yelabuga, unfortunately, there are victims of the destruction of the premises. description: A Ukrainian-made Aeroprakt A-22 light aircraft, possibly converted for unmanned control and loaded with explosives, was used to attack the Alabuga SEZ. The aircraft's flight range could be increased by removing interior parts, and it may have flown at an extremely low altitude to bypass air defense zones.
original:
Forwarded from: Military chronicle
The attack on the Alabuga SEZ could be carried out using a Ukrainian-made Aeroprakt A-22 light aircraft. Apparently, the board was converted for unmanned control and loaded with a small amount of explosives (or flew without any at all).

The flight range without modifications can be 1,100 kilometers, but if you remove some interior parts, it can be increased.

The idea of converting manned aircraft into unmanned ones is not new; similar projects exist in many countries around the world, and any “corn farmer” can become a kamikaze drone.

Soviet An-2s, for example, were used by Azerbaijan as a means of detecting Armenian air defenses during the war for Nagorno-Karabakh. For takeoff and takeoff, such an aircraft requires 100-150 meters, so there is no need to use an airfield for takeoff. In addition, there are many such aircraft - in 2021, the manufacturer reported the production of thousands of such aircraft. In addition to Ukraine, the A-22 is assembled on the territory of AEROPRAKT Polska Sp.z o.o in Zaklichin (Poland).

A separate question is how the plane managed to overcome 1200 kilometers to Tatarstan. Most likely, there was no talk about a direct flight. In this case, the probability of losing the car would be high. Most likely, the flight took place at an extremely low altitude, bypassing air defense zones (who and how provided data on positional areas is another question that will need to be answered).

Another question that requires clarification is why the facility where the Geran-2 UAVs are assembled (the plane did not reach it by several hundred meters) was not reliably covered by air defense and protected from attacks by low-altitude drones.

Information about routes around air defense zones could be provided by US optical-electronic and electronic reconnaissance satellites. The sensors installed on them are capable of determining the positions and types of air defense systems by their visual portraits and the radiation parameters of their radars. @MChroniclesBot - send your photos and videos from the front. event: Transfer of Flowers from Memorial to Graves
description: In Rostov, flowers from a memorial to victims of a terrorist attack were transferred to the graves of Russian soldiers who died in the war in Ukraine. The decision was met with outrage from local residents, who felt it was disrespectful to the original victims and their families.
original:
In Rostov, flowers from the memorial to the victims of the terrorist attack in Crocus were placed on the graves of participants in the war in Ukraine. This outraged the residents of Rostov-on-Don, flowers from the memorial to the victims of the attack on Crocus City Hall were transported to the Alley of Heroes of the Northern Cemetery, where Russian soldiers who died in the war in Ukraine are buried. The portal 161.Ru writes about this.

Volunteers of the organization "Mercy-on-Don" who carried the flowers explained this by saying that the memorial in memory of those killed in the terrorist attack was temporary. Taking this into account, local authorities decided to transfer the toys and flowers brought by Rostov residents to the organization.

“We decided that it would be right to lay bouquets on the graves of the soldiers buried in the Sector of Courage on the Alley of Heroes,” said the organization’s press secretary Maria Gichenko. According to her, flowers were also laid at the Great Patriotic War memorial.

Volunteers decided to donate children's toys that residents brought to the memorial to the victims of the terrorist attack to orphanages in Donbass.

At the same time, the cemetery itself did not give consent to the transfer of flowers. Also, close relatives of the military spoke out against this decision. “People brought flowers for a completely different reason, not for our guys. Why were these flowers transported at all?” - says Natalya Fedorchenko, the mother of a military man who is buried on the Alla of Heroes.

The wife of another military man called the transfer of flowers “disrespectful to those who died in the terrorist attack, and to the deceased members of the North Military District, and to the relatives of the victims.” Photo: “Mercy-on-Don” / Telegram Subscribe to Dozhdya’s Telegram Watch us on YouTube

description: Pavel Danilov, the former Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Construction of Chuvashia, was arrested in a corruption case related to the Mortgage Corporation of the Chuvash Republic. He received 32 million rubles in bribes from the corporation's general director, Alexey Antonov.
original:
Forwarded from: Regional Policy
The fight against corruption that unfolded in the regions of Russia led to a major loss of personnel in Chuvashia. The now former Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Construction, Pavel Danilov, who had a strong position not only in the region, but also in the federal center, was arrested. But the fight against corruption did not spare the official, who successfully rose to the top with the support of the head of the region before last, Nikolai Fedorov, and was again brought into the team by the current head, Oleg Nikolaev.

Danilov's case is connected with the Mortgage Corporation of the Chuvash Republic, which belongs to the government of this region. An accomplice was also arrested - the general director of this corporation, Alexey Antonov, who, according to investigators, gave Danilov 32 million rubles in bribes. A bag with 18 million rubles was found on Danilov, which is considered part of the bribe. Antonov also turned out to be a wealthy man - three pairs of expensive Swiss watches were found in his apartment.

Danilov began his career in the administration of the city of Cheboksary, where he became deputy head of the city for economic development. Fedorov, having left the post of head of the republic and continuing his career at the federal level, took over the post of head of the Ministry of Agriculture and took Danilov to his place. Then Danilov headed the Russian Center for State Monitoring of Agricultural Lands and the Main Computing Center of the Ministry of Agriculture. After Fedorov moved to the Federation Council, Danilov managed to continue his career in the government and just then became involved in construction issues. At the Ministry of Construction and Housing and Communal Services of the Russian Federation, Danilov was hired by the then minister Mikhail Men, but then Danilov managed to work with the next minister, Vladimir Yakushev, and - briefly - with Irek Fayzullin. At the ministry, Danilov was the head of the Federal Center for Pricing in Construction and the Building Materials Industry and the Project Directorate.

However, under Faizullin, Danilov still left the ministry. He was hired by Nikolaev, who had recently been appointed head of Chuvashia, under whom many members of Fedorov’s team began to return to power. In Chuvashia, Danilov actively took up the construction business, which was not without scandals. One of them was related to the construction of the so-called antenna field in Cheboksary, which caused indignation among the townspeople. The federal corporation DOM.RF received the land there. Another scandal was the construction in Cheboksary on the site of an oak grove.

Danilov’s arrest is not the first blow to Nikolaev’s team, which in many ways is Fedorov’s well-forgotten old team. Prior to this, Transport Minister Vladimir Osipov came under investigation. The arrest shows both Fedorov’s loss of his once powerful connections and influence, and the instability of Nikolaev’s current positions. In part, this is a call for SRZP, through which he promoted and became the head of the Nikolaev region. Given Danilov's great influence in the region and his prominence in the federal government, the blow has been dealt a serious blow. Nikolaev will have to think about how to re-strengthen his relations with the center and not lose his post.TelegramRegional politicsThe corruption investigation turned out to be a sensitive blow to the command of the head of Chuvashia.VIEW MESSAGE

description: Pakistan developed the Nasr system, a multi-launch rocket system (MLRS) capable of delivering nuclear charges. The system was first tested in 2011 and entered service in 2013. Nowadays, the North Korean 600-mm “super-large MLRS” is widely known in the world, which can also be used to carry out nuclear strikes. But the first in the genre of “MLRS which seems to simultaneously launch operational-tactical missiles and also be a standard nuclear weapon” were the Pakistanis.

We are talking about the Nasr system. It was first tested in 2011. In 2013, it entered service with the Pakistani army. And this weapon, being classified as an MLRS according to many classifications, was immediately designed as a means of delivering nuclear charges.

The performance characteristics of the missiles are as follows. The caliber of the missiles is 400 mm. Firing range - up to 70 km. The warhead is either non-nuclear 400 kg (options: high-explosive fragmentation, cassette), or nuclear with a yield of up to 10 kilotons. Guided missiles. The accuracy is stated to be 10 meters. One vehicle has up to 4 missiles. The launcher can be simultaneously equipped with nuclear and non-nuclear missiles in different combinations. And the possibility of any such flying missile having a nuclear charge sharply increases the requirements for the reliability of air defense/missile defense when protecting against them.

Pakistan views Nasr as one of the key asymmetric deterrents against India. And in case of war, as a means of defeating the invading forces when Indian troops break through Pakistan’s defenses on the border.

And we must pay tribute, with the Nasr project, Pakistan was able to create its own analogue.#MLRS#PakistanMilitary Informant

description: Researchers at F.A.C.C.T. have identified a new campaign targeting Russian media managers, marketers, journalists, and PR professionals on Telegram. The attackers use phishing login forms on 462 detected domains, including alliance-online24[.]ru, to steal accounts. The scheme involves voting in competitions, and once compromised, the attackers send out mailings to the victim's contact database, contributing to a more trusting attitude towards the mailing list.
original:
Forwarded from: SecAtor
F.A.C.C.T. researchers are warning about the launch of a new campaign targeting Telegram users from among Russian media managers, marketers, journalists and PR professionals to hijack their accounts.

Experts were able to detect 462 domains used to steal Telegram accounts using various legends, including voting in competitions through resources with phishing login forms.

As we also reported earlier, mass account thefts using this scheme began last summer.

At first, scammers used the legend with children's drawing, singing or ballet competitions, and since December they switched to more adult scenarios.

To carry out the attack, the victim is added to the group with a request to vote in the competition THE BEST PROJECT MANAGER or Marketing and PR Specialist. Without going into too much trouble, such channels are usually called Hello Everyone, Good afternoon everyone or Good morning! to complicate their search and identification.

Then a redirect occurs to another resource, for example, alliance-online24[.]ru, where the voting participant is asked to log in to Telegram via a QR code or by sending a code not to the phone.

As a result, the account is compromised - or, more simply put, it is taken over. After this, he quickly disconnects from the current number, and the victim loses access to correspondence and contacts.

Having hijacked an account, attackers send out a mailing with an offer to participate in voting in the victim’s contact database, the inclusion of which in the distribution scheme contributes to a more trusting attitude of the victim’s environment towards the mailing list.

Since December 2023, attackers have registered 462 voting domains. Of these, 85 were in February and 162 in March.

A complete list with examples of mailings is in the report F.A.C.C.T. event: Retender for Batoka Hydroelectric Power Station
description: Zambia and Zimbabwe are re-tendering for the construction of the Batoka hydroelectric power station on the Zambezi River, worth $5 billion. The project aims to regulate reservoirs for electricity production and flood control, increasing electricity output during peak seasons and storing water for dry seasons.
original:
Forwarded from: African Studies
🇿🇲🇿🇼Zambia and Zimbabwe will hold a re-tender for the construction of the Batoka hydroelectric power station on the Zambezi River worth $5 billion. The implementation of the project was previously entrusted to General Electric Co. and Power Construction Corp. of China. In June 2023, Zambian Energy Minister Peter Kapalazaya announced his country's withdrawal of the 2019 contract due to non-compliance with the terms of the tender.

The tender is being held by the Zambezi River Authority (ZRA), a joint venture between Zambia and Zimbabwe created to manage the resources of the Zambezi River, as well as the Kariba hydroelectric station. ZRA expects to receive proposals from potential bidders by April 2025 and to finalize the tender 5 months thereafter.

The new hydropower plant will help regulate reservoirs for electricity production and flood control. Electricity output from the Batoka hydropower plant will be increased during the peak season and water will be stored in the Kariba Reservoir for use during the dry season.

The previous Batoki project involved the construction of a dam with a height of 181 meters and a hydroelectric power station with a design capacity of 2,400 MW.@africanists

German Foreign Minister Annalena Bärbock, although expressing her concerns more diplomatically, also emphasized the unpredictability of the situation in the event of a Ukrainian defeat.
